contentrichtext.text: :''For the paranormal concept of dark magic, see [[Black magic]].'' '''''Dark Magic''''' ([[1939 in film|1939]]) is a [[short film|short]] [[comedy film]] produced by [[Robert Benchley]] for [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]]. Benchley appears as Joe Doakes, who goes to a magic shop to see a magician perform magic tricks. Sharp-eyed viewers will recognize "Mr. Calypso", the magic demonstrator, as none other than sleight-of-hand master [[John Scarne]]. ==References== * Nathaniel Benchley, ''Robert Benchley, a biography''. (New York City, [[McGraw-Hill]], 1955) ==See also== *[[List of Robert Benchley collections and film appearances]] ==External links== * {{imdb title|0031209|Dark Magic}} [[Category:Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer short films]] [[Category:1939 films]] {{short-film-stub}}
